{
  "name": "basic_template",
  "private": true,
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "vite --port 3000",
    "start": "vite --port 3000",
    "build": "npm run check:safe && vite build",
    "serve": "vite preview",
    "test": "vitest run",
    "check": "tsgo --noEmit && npm run lint:radix -- --fix && npm run format",
    "check:safe": "timeout 20 npm run check || (echo 'Check timed out after 20 seconds' && exit 1)",
    "format": "biome check --write --unsafe",
    "format:quiet": "biome check --write --unsafe --log-level=warn",
    "lint:radix": "grep -l -r '<SelectItem' src | xargs eslint --config config/eslint/eslint.radix.config.js",
    "lint:mcp": "eslint src --config config/eslint/eslint.mcp.config.js",
    "lint:validate": "node config/eslint/validate-configs.js",
    "prepare": "if [ -f ./bin/setup-githooks.sh ]; then ./bin/setup-githooks.sh; fi"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@fortawesome/fontawesome-svg-core": "^7.0.0",

1‚Üí# Store Integration Guide
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíAI Accountant has been integrated with multiple app stores and payment platforms:
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Google Play Store** - In-App Purchases via Google Play Billing Library
     8‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Apple App Store** - In-App Purchases via StoreKit 2
     9‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Palm Store** - In-App Purchases via webOS Payment Service
    10‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Web Payments** - Stripe, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí## Architecture
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üí### Service Layer
    15‚Üí
    16‚ÜíAll store integrations follow a unified architecture:
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí```
    19‚Üísrc/services/
    20‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ google-play-iap.ts    # Google Play Billing integration
    21‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ apple-store-iap.ts    # Apple StoreKit integration
    22‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ palm-store-iap.ts     # Palm webOS Payment integration
    23‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ purchase-manager.ts   # Unified purchase manager
    24‚Üí```
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí### Purchase Manager (`purchase-manager.ts`)
    27‚Üí
    28‚ÜíThe `PurchaseManager` class provides a unified interface for all platforms:
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí- **Platform Detection** - Automatically detects the current platform
    31‚Üí- **Unified API** - Single interface for all store purchases
    32‚Üí- **Purchase Verification** - Server-side receipt validation
    33‚Üí- **Restore Purchases** - Restore previous purchases across platforms
    34‚Üí- **Local Storage Sync** - Persists purchase status
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí## Features
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí### 1. Google Play Integration (`google-play-iap.ts`)
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí**Features:**
    41‚Üí- Product querying via Google Play Billing Library
    42‚Üí- Purchase flow with receipt generation
    43‚Üí- Server-side receipt verification
    44‚Üí- Purchase acknowledgement (required by Google)
    45‚Üí- Purchase restoration
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí**Product ID:** `ai_accountant_lifetime_50usd`
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí**Production Requirements:**
    50‚Üí1. Google Play Console setup
    51‚Üí2. Product SKU configuration
    52‚Üí3. Google Play Billing Library integration (for Android apps)
    53‚Üí4. Backend endpoint: `/api/verify-google-play-purchase`
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí### 2. Apple App Store Integration (`apple-store-iap.ts`)
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí**Features:**
    58‚Üí- Product querying via StoreKit 2
    59‚Üí- Purchase flow with transaction handling
    60‚Üí- Receipt verification with Apple servers
    61‚Üí- Transaction finishing (required by Apple)
    62‚Üí- Purchase restoration
    63‚Üí- Subscription status checking (future-ready)
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí**Product ID:** `com.aiaccountant.lifetime.50usd`
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí**Production Requirements:**
    68‚Üí1. App Store Connect setup
    69‚Üí2. Product ID configuration
    70‚Üí3. StoreKit configuration file
    71‚Üí4. Backend endpoint: `/api/verify-apple-receipt`
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí### 3. Palm Store Integration (`palm-store-iap.ts`)
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí**Features:**
    76‚Üí- Product querying via webOS Payment Service
    77‚Üí- Purchase flow for webOS devices
    78‚Üí- Receipt verification
    79‚Üí- Purchase consumption (for consumables)
    80‚Üí- Purchase history and ownership checking
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí**Product ID:** `aiaccountant_lifetime_access`
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí**Production Requirements:**
    85‚Üí1. Palm Developer Account
    86‚Üí2. Product setup in Palm Store Developer Console
    87‚Üí3. webOS SDK integration
    88‚Üí4. Backend endpoint: `/api/verify-palm-purchase`
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí### 4. Unified Purchase Manager (`purchase-manager.ts`)
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí**Features:**
    93‚Üí- Platform auto-detection (iOS, Android, webOS, Web)
    94‚Üí- Unified purchase flow across all platforms
    95‚Üí- Purchase restoration
    96‚Üí- Purchase status checking
    97‚Üí- Store URL generation
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí**API:**
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí```typescript
   102‚Üíimport { purchaseManager } from '@/services/purchase-manager';
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí// Initialize
   105‚Üíawait purchaseManager.initialize();
   106‚Üí
   107‚Üí// Get current platform
   108‚Üíconst platform = purchaseManager.getPlatform(); // 'googleplay' | 'appstore' | 'palmstore' | 'web'
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí// Purchase via store
   111‚Üíconst result = await purchaseManager.purchaseViaStore();
   112‚Üíif (result.success) {
   113‚Üí  console.log('Purchase successful:', result.purchaseId);
   114‚Üí}
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí// Restore purchases
   117‚Üíconst restoreResult = await purchaseManager.restorePurchases();
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí// Check purchase status
   120‚Üíconst info = purchaseManager.getPurchaseInfo();
   121‚Üíif (info.hasPurchase) {
   122‚Üí  console.log('Purchased on:', info.platform);
   123‚Üí}
   124‚Üí
   125‚Üí// Clear purchase data (testing/logout)
   126‚ÜípurchaseManager.clearPurchaseData();
   127‚Üí```
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí## UI Components
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí### PricingPaywall Component
   132‚Üí
   133‚ÜíUpdated with full store integration:
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üí**Features:**
   136‚Üí- Platform detection badge
   137‚Üí- Auto-select appropriate payment tab based on platform
   138‚Üí- Google Play purchase button
   139‚Üí- App Store purchase button
   140‚Üí- Palm Store purchase button
   141‚Üí- Restore purchases button with loading state
   142‚Üí- Fallback to web redirect if IAP not available
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Flow:**
   145‚Üí1. Component detects platform on mount
   146‚Üí2. Shows appropriate payment options
   147‚Üí3. User selects payment method
   148‚Üí4. Handles purchase via unified API
   149‚Üí5. Displays success message
   150‚Üí6. Unlocks app access
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí## Purchase Flow
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí### Mobile App Stores (Google Play, App Store, Palm Store)
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí```
   157‚ÜíUser clicks "Purchase"
   158‚Üí  ‚Üì
   159‚ÜíPurchase Manager detects platform
   160‚Üí  ‚Üì
   161‚ÜíCalls platform-specific IAP service
   162‚Üí  ‚Üì
   163‚ÜíLaunches native purchase dialog
   164‚Üí  ‚Üì
   165‚ÜíUser completes purchase
   166‚Üí  ‚Üì
   167‚ÜíReceipt generated
   168‚Üí  ‚Üì
   169‚ÜíBackend verifies receipt with store servers
   170‚Üí  ‚Üì
   171‚ÜíPurchase acknowledged/finished
   172‚Üí  ‚Üì
   173‚ÜíApp unlocked
   174‚Üí  ‚Üì
   175‚ÜíPurchase info saved to localStorage
   176‚Üí```
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí### Web Payments (Stripe, PayPal, etc.)
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí```
   181‚ÜíUser clicks payment button
   182‚Üí  ‚Üì
   183‚ÜíPayment provider modal opens
   184‚Üí  ‚Üì
   185‚ÜíUser completes payment
   186‚Üí  ‚Üì
   187‚ÜíPayment success callback
   188‚Üí  ‚Üì
   189‚ÜíPurchase info saved to localStorage
   190‚Üí  ‚Üì
   191‚ÜíApp unlocked
   192‚Üí```
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí## Backend Requirements
   195‚Üí
   196‚ÜíFor production deployment, you need server-side receipt validation:
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí### Google Play Verification Endpoint
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí```typescript
   201‚ÜíPOST /api/verify-google-play-purchase
   202‚ÜíBody: {
   203‚Üí  productId: string,
   204‚Üí  purchaseToken: string,
   205‚Üí  receipt: string
   206‚Üí}
   207‚ÜíResponse: {
   208‚Üí  valid: boolean,
   209‚Üí  orderId?: string
   210‚Üí}
   211‚Üí```
   212‚Üí
   213‚Üí**Implementation:**
   214‚Üí- Use Google Play Developer API
   215‚Üí- Verify purchase token and receipt
   216‚Üí- Check purchase state (0 = purchased)
   217‚Üí- Return validation result
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí### Apple App Store Verification Endpoint
   220‚Üí
   221‚Üí```typescript
   222‚ÜíPOST /api/verify-apple-receipt
   223‚ÜíBody: {
   224‚Üí  receipt: string
   225‚Üí}
   226‚ÜíResponse: {
   227‚Üí  status: number, // 0 = valid
   228‚Üí  receipt?: object
   229‚Üí}
   230‚Üí```
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí**Implementation:**
   233‚Üí- Use Apple App Store Server API
   234‚Üí- Verify receipt with Apple servers
   235‚Üí- Production URL: `https://buy.itunes.apple.com/verifyReceipt`
   236‚Üí- Sandbox URL: `https://sandbox.itunes.apple.com/verifyReceipt`
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí### Palm Store Verification Endpoint
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí```typescript
   241‚ÜíPOST /api/verify-palm-purchase
   242‚ÜíBody: {
   243‚Üí  purchaseId: string,
   244‚Üí  purchaseToken: string,
   245‚Üí  receipt: string
   246‚Üí}
   247‚ÜíResponse: {
   248‚Üí  valid: boolean,
   249‚Üí  purchaseId?: string
   250‚Üí}
   251‚Üí```
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí**Implementation:**
   254‚Üí- Use Palm Store API
   255‚Üí- Verify purchase token and receipt
   256‚Üí- Check purchase status
   257‚Üí- Return validation result
   258‚Üí
   259‚Üí## Environment Detection
   260‚Üí
   261‚ÜíThe system automatically detects the environment:
   262‚Üí
   263‚Üí```typescript
   264‚Üí// iOS Detection
   265‚Üí- User agent contains: iphone, ipad, ipod
   266‚Üí- window.webkit.messageHandlers.StoreKit exists
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí// Android Detection
   269‚Üí- User agent contains: android
   270‚Üí- window.AndroidBillingClient exists
   271‚Üí
   272‚Üí// webOS Detection
   273‚Üí- User agent contains: webos, web0s, hpwos
   274‚Üí- window.PalmSystem exists
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí// Web Fallback
   277‚Üí- None of the above
   278‚Üí```

   326‚Üí## Security Considerations
   327‚Üí
   328‚Üí### Client-Side
   329‚Üí- Never trust client-side purchase validation
   330‚Üí- Always verify receipts server-side
   331‚Üí- Use HTTPS for all API calls
   332‚Üí- Implement rate limiting
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí### Server-Side
   335‚Üí- Verify all receipts with official store APIs
   336‚Üí- Validate purchase tokens
   337‚Üí- Check for duplicate receipts
   338‚Üí- Implement webhook listeners for updates
   339‚Üí- Store purchase records in database
   340‚Üí
   341‚Üí### Data Storage
   342‚Üí- Encrypt sensitive purchase data
   343‚Üí- Use secure localStorage alternatives for sensitive info
   344‚Üí- Implement purchase verification on app start
   345‚Üí- Sync with backend periodically
   346‚Üí

   389‚Üí## Support
   390‚Üí
   391‚Üí### Common Issues
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí**Issue:** "Store not available"
   394‚Üí- **Solution:** Check platform detection, ensure correct environment
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí**Issue:** "Purchase verification failed"
   397‚Üí- **Solution:** Check backend endpoint, verify receipt format
   398‚Üí
   399‚Üí**Issue:** "Restore purchases failed"
   400‚Üí- **Solution:** Ensure user has made previous purchase, check receipt storage
   401‚Üí
   402‚Üí**Issue:** "Purchase already owned"
   403‚Üí- **Solution:** Check purchase status, implement restore flow

# Store Integration Guide

## Overview

AI Accountant has been integrated with multiple app stores and payment platforms:

- ‚úÖ **Google Play Store** - In-App Purchases via Google Play Billing Library
- ‚úÖ **Apple App Store** - In-App Purchases via StoreKit 2
- ‚úÖ **Palm Store** - In-App Purchases via webOS Payment Service
- ‚úÖ **Web Payments** - Stripe, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay

## Architecture

### Service Layer

All store integrations follow a unified architecture:

```
src/services/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ google-play-iap.ts    # Google Play Billing integration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ apple-store-iap.ts    # Apple StoreKit integration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ palm-store-iap.ts     # Palm webOS Payment integration
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ purchase-manager.ts   # Unified purchase manager
```

### Purchase Manager (`purchase-manager.ts`)

The `PurchaseManager` class provides a unified interface for all platforms:

- **Platform Detection** - Automatically detects the current platform
- **Unified API** - Single interface for all store purchases
- **Purchase Verification** - Server-side receipt validation
- **Restore Purchases** - Restore previous purchases across platforms
- **Local Storage Sync** - Persists purchase status

## Features

### 1. Google Play Integration (`google-play-iap.ts`)

**Features:**
- Product querying via Google Play Billing Library
- Purchase flow with receipt generation
- Server-side receipt verification
- Purchase acknowledgement (required by Google)
- Purchase restoration

**Product ID:** `ai_accountant_lifetime_50usd`

**Production Requirements:**
1. Google Play Console setup
2. Product SKU configuration
3. Google Play Billing Library integration (for Android apps)
4. Backend endpoint: `/api/verify-google-play-purchase`

### 2. Apple App Store Integration (`apple-store-iap.ts`)

**Features:**
- Product querying via StoreKit 2
- Purchase flow with transaction handling
- Receipt verification with Apple servers
- Transaction finishing (required by Apple)
- Purchase restoration
- Subscription status checking (future-ready)

**Product ID:** `com.aiaccountant.lifetime.50usd`

**Production Requirements:**
1. App Store Connect setup
2. Product ID configuration
3. StoreKit configuration file
4. Backend endpoint: `/api/verify-apple-receipt`

### 3. Palm Store Integration (`palm-store-iap.ts`)

**Features:**
- Product querying via webOS Payment Service
- Purchase flow for webOS devices
- Receipt verification
- Purchase consumption (for consumables)
- Purchase history and ownership checking

**Product ID:** `aiaccountant_lifetime_access`

**Production Requirements:**
1. Palm Developer Account
2. Product setup in Palm Store Developer Console
3. webOS SDK integration
4. Backend endpoint: `/api/verify-palm-purchase`

### 4. Unified Purchase Manager (`purchase-manager.ts`)

**Features:**
- Platform auto-detection (iOS, Android, webOS, Web)
- Unified purchase flow across all platforms
- Purchase restoration
- Purchase status checking
- Store URL generation

**API:**

```typescript
import { purchaseManager } from '@/services/purchase-manager';

// Initialize
await purchaseManager.initialize();

// Get current platform
const platform = purchaseManager.getPlatform(); // 'googleplay' | 'appstore' | 'palmstore' | 'web'

// Purchase via store
const result = await purchaseManager.purchaseViaStore();
if (result.success) {
  console.log('Purchase successful:', result.purchaseId);
}

// Restore purchases
const restoreResult = await purchaseManager.restorePurchases();

// Check purchase status
const info = purchaseManager.getPurchaseInfo();
if (info.hasPurchase) {
  console.log('Purchased on:', info.platform);
}

// Clear purchase data (testing/logout)
purchaseManager.clearPurchaseData();
```

## UI Components

### PricingPaywall Component

Updated with full store integration:

**Features:**
- Platform detection badge
- Auto-select appropriate payment tab based on platform
- Google Play purchase button
- App Store purchase button
- Palm Store purchase button
- Restore purchases button with loading state
- Fallback to web redirect if IAP not available

**Flow:**
1. Component detects platform on mount
2. Shows appropriate payment options
3. User selects payment method
4. Handles purchase via unified API
5. Displays success message
6. Unlocks app access

## Purchase Flow

### Mobile App Stores (Google Play, App Store, Palm Store)

```
User clicks "Purchase"
  ‚Üì
Purchase Manager detects platform
  ‚Üì
Calls platform-specific IAP service
  ‚Üì
Launches native purchase dialog
  ‚Üì
User completes purchase
  ‚Üì
Receipt generated
  ‚Üì
Backend verifies receipt with store servers
  ‚Üì
Purchase acknowledged/finished
  ‚Üì
App unlocked
  ‚Üì
Purchase info saved to localStorage
```

### Web Payments (Stripe, PayPal, etc.)

```
User clicks payment button
  ‚Üì
Payment provider modal opens
  ‚Üì
User completes payment
  ‚Üì
Payment success callback
  ‚Üì
Purchase info saved to localStorage
  ‚Üì
App unlocked
```

## Backend Requirements

For production deployment, you need server-side receipt validation:

### Google Play Verification Endpoint

```typescript
POST /api/verify-google-play-purchase
Body: {
  productId: string,
  purchaseToken: string,
  receipt: string
}
Response: {
  valid: boolean,
  orderId?: string
}
```

**Implementation:**
- Use Google Play Developer API
- Verify purchase token and receipt
- Check purchase state (0 = purchased)
- Return validation result

### Apple App Store Verification Endpoint

```typescript
POST /api/verify-apple-receipt
Body: {
  receipt: string
}
Response: {
  status: number, // 0 = valid
  receipt?: object
}
```

**Implementation:**
- Use Apple App Store Server API
- Verify receipt with Apple servers
- Production URL: `https://buy.itunes.apple.com/verifyReceipt`
- Sandbox URL: `https://sandbox.itunes.apple.com/verifyReceipt`

### Palm Store Verification Endpoint

```typescript
POST /api/verify-palm-purchase
Body: {
  purchaseId: string,
  purchaseToken: string,
  receipt: string
}
Response: {
  valid: boolean,
  purchaseId?: string
}
```

**Implementation:**
- Use Palm Store API
- Verify purchase token and receipt
- Check purchase status
- Return validation result

## Environment Detection

The system automatically detects the environment:

```typescript
// iOS Detection
- User agent contains: iphone, ipad, ipod
- window.webkit.messageHandlers.StoreKit exists

// Android Detection
- User agent contains: android
- window.AndroidBillingClient exists

// webOS Detection
- User agent contains: webos, web0s, hpwos
- window.PalmSystem exists

// Web Fallback
- None of the above
```

## Testing

### Development Mode

All IAP services have mock implementations for testing:

- Mock product details
- Simulated purchase flows
- Mock receipt generation
- Auto-verified purchases

### Testing Restore Purchases

```typescript
// 1. Complete a purchase
await purchaseManager.purchaseViaStore();

// 2. Clear app data (simulate reinstall)
localStorage.clear();

// 3. Restore purchases
const result = await purchaseManager.restorePurchases();
// Should restore purchase and unlock app
```

### Testing Different Platforms

Use browser developer tools to simulate:

```javascript
// Simulate iOS
Object.defineProperty(navigator, 'userAgent', {
  get: () => 'Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 14_0 like Mac OS X)'
});

// Simulate Android
Object.defineProperty(navigator, 'userAgent', {
  get: () => 'Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 11)'
});

// Simulate webOS
Object.defineProperty(navigator, 'userAgent', {
  get: () => 'Mozilla/5.0 (Web0S; Linux/SmartTV)'
});
```

## Security Considerations

### Client-Side
- Never trust client-side purchase validation
- Always verify receipts server-side
- Use HTTPS for all API calls
- Implement rate limiting

### Server-Side
- Verify all receipts with official store APIs
- Validate purchase tokens
- Check for duplicate receipts
- Implement webhook listeners for updates
- Store purchase records in database

### Data Storage
- Encrypt sensitive purchase data
- Use secure localStorage alternatives for sensitive info
- Implement purchase verification on app start
- Sync with backend periodically

## Production Deployment Checklist

### Google Play
- [ ] Create app in Google Play Console
- [ ] Configure product SKUs
- [ ] Set up pricing
- [ ] Enable Google Play Billing
- [ ] Integrate Billing Library in Android app
- [ ] Set up receipt verification backend
- [ ] Test with test accounts
- [ ] Submit for review

### Apple App Store
- [ ] Create app in App Store Connect
- [ ] Configure product IDs
- [ ] Set up pricing tiers
- [ ] Create StoreKit configuration file
- [ ] Integrate StoreKit 2
- [ ] Set up receipt verification backend
- [ ] Test with sandbox accounts
- [ ] Submit for review

### Palm Store
- [ ] Create Palm Developer account
- [ ] Register app in Palm Store
- [ ] Configure product details
- [ ] Set up pricing
- [ ] Integrate webOS SDK
- [ ] Set up verification backend
- [ ] Test on webOS emulator
- [ ] Submit for review

### Backend
- [ ] Deploy receipt verification endpoints
- [ ] Set up database for purchase records
- [ ] Implement webhook listeners
- [ ] Configure monitoring and alerts
- [ ] Set up backup verification
- [ ] Test all endpoints
- [ ] Enable rate limiting
- [ ] Add logging and analytics

## Support

### Common Issues

**Issue:** "Store not available"
- **Solution:** Check platform detection, ensure correct environment

**Issue:** "Purchase verification failed"
- **Solution:** Check backend endpoint, verify receipt format

**Issue:** "Restore purchases failed"
- **Solution:** Ensure user has made previous purchase, check receipt storage

**Issue:** "Purchase already owned"
- **Solution:** Check purchase status, implement restore flow

### Contact

For technical support: support@aiaccountant.app

## License

Proprietary - AI Accountant ¬© 2024

## ü§ñ –í–ê–†–ò–ê–ù–¢ 2: Google Play - –¢–†–ï–ë–£–ï–¢–°–Ø –ù–ê–¢–ò–í–ù–ê–Ø –û–ë–Å–†–¢–ö–ê

Google Play **–ù–ï –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç** —á–∏—Å—Ç—ã–µ –≤–µ–±-–ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è. –ù—É–∂–Ω–æ —É–ø–∞–∫–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤ Android app.

### –°–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã —É–ø–∞–∫–æ–≤–∫–∏:

#### –ê) Capacitor (–†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É–µ—Ç—Å—è)

**Capacitor** - –æ—Ç —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π Ionic, —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∞–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–∞ Cordova.

# 3. –°–æ–±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –≤–µ–±-–ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ

**–ß—Ç–æ –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ:**
- –ù–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Ç–µ –∏–∫–æ–Ω–∫–∏ –∏ splash screen
- –ù–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Ç–µ signing (–∫–ª—é—á –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å–∏)
- –°–æ–±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ APK/AAB —Ñ–∞–π–ª
- –ó–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∏—Ç–µ –≤ Google Play Console

#### –ë) React Native WebView

–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ React Native –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å WebView.

#### –í) PWA Builder (–ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π)

**PWA Builder** —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—ë—Ç Android –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏.

### –ü—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è –≤ Google Play

const CACHE_NAME = 'ai-accountant-v1';
const urlsToCache = ['/', '/index.html', '/assets/index.css', '/assets/index.js'];

self.addEventListener('install', (event) => {
  event.waitUntil(
    caches.open(CACHE_NAME).then((cache) => cache.addAll(urlsToCache))
  );
});

self.addEventListener('fetch', (event) => {
  event.respondWith(
    caches.match(event.request).then((response) => response || fetch(event.request))
  );
});
```

## üöÄ –ë–´–°–¢–†–´–ô –°–¢–ê–†–¢: PWA (–†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É–µ—Ç—Å—è)

PWA - —Å–∞–º—ã–π –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∞–≤–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–º **–±–µ–∑ –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–æ–≤**.

### –®–∞–≥ 1: –§–∞–π–ª—ã —É–∂–µ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã! ‚úÖ

- ‚úÖ `public/manifest.json` - –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è PWA
- ‚úÖ –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ Service Worker

### –®–∞–≥ 2: –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ Service Worker

```bash
# –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª –≤ public/
cat > public/sw.js << 'EOF'
const CACHE_NAME = 'ai-accountant-v1.0.0';
const urlsToCache = [
  '/',
  '/index.html'
];

// Install Service Worker
self.addEventListener('install', (event) => {
  event.waitUntil(
    caches.open(CACHE_NAME)
      .then((cache) => cache.addAll(urlsToCache))
  );
});

// Fetch from cache
self.addEventListener('fetch', (event) => {
  event.respondWith(
    caches.match(event.request)
      .then((response) => response || fetch(event.request))
  );
});

// Update Service Worker
self.addEventListener('activate', (event) => {
  event.waitUntil(
    caches.keys().then((cacheNames) => {
      return Promise.all(
        cacheNames.map((cacheName) => {
          if (cacheName !== CACHE_NAME) {
            return caches.delete(cacheName);
          }
        })
      );
    })
  );
});
EOF
```

### –®–∞–≥ 3: –ó–∞—Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ Service Worker –≤ index.html

## üöÄ –ë–´–°–¢–†–´–ô –°–¢–ê–†–¢: PWA (–†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É–µ—Ç—Å—è)

PWA - —Å–∞–º—ã–π –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∞–≤–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–º **–±–µ–∑ –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–æ–≤**.

### –®–∞–≥ 1: –§–∞–π–ª—ã —É–∂–µ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã! ‚úÖ

- ‚úÖ `public/manifest.json` - –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è PWA
- ‚úÖ –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ Service Worker

### –®–∞–≥ 2: –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ Service Worker

```bash
# –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ —Ñ–∞–π–ª –≤ public/
cat > public/sw.js << 'EOF'
const CACHE_NAME = 'ai-accountant-v1.0.0';
const urlsToCache = [
  '/',
  '/index.html'
];

// Install Service Worker
self.addEventListener('install', (event) => {
  event.waitUntil(
    caches.open(CACHE_NAME)
      .then((cache) => cache.addAll(urlsToCache))
  );
});

// Fetch from cache
self.addEventListener('fetch', (event) => {
  event.respondWith(
    caches.match(event.request)
      .then((response) => response || fetch(event.request))
  );
});

// Update Service Worker
self.addEventListener('activate', (event) => {
  event.waitUntil(
    caches.keys().then((cacheNames) => {
      return Promise.all(
        cacheNames.map((cacheName) => {
          if (cacheName !== CACHE_NAME) {
            return caches.delete(cacheName);
          }
        })
      );
    })
  );
});
EOF
```

### –®–∞–≥ 3: –ó–∞—Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ Service Worker –≤ index.html

–î–æ–±–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ `</body>`:

```html
<script>
  if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
    window.addEventListener('load', () => {
      navigator.serviceWorker.register('/sw.js')
        .then(reg => console.log('SW registered:', reg))
        .catch(err => console.log('SW error:', err));
    });
  }
</script>
```

#!/bin/bash

# Script to package AI Accountant for Palm Store (webOS)
# Usage: ./scripts/package-webos.sh

set -e

echo "üì¶ Packaging AI Accountant for webOS Palm Store..."

# Colors
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Step 1: Build the app
echo -e "\n${BLUE}Step 1: Building application...${NC}"
npm run build

# Step 2: Copy appinfo.json
echo -e "\n${BLUE}Step 2: Copying appinfo.json...${NC}"
cp appinfo.json dist/

# Step 3: Check for icons (optional - warn if missing)
echo -e "\n${BLUE}Step 3: Checking for icons...${NC}"
if [ -f "public/icon.png" ]; then
    cp public/icon.png dist/
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì icon.png copied${NC}"
else
    echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: public/icon.png not found (80x80 required)"
fi

if [ -f "public/largeIcon.png" ]; then
    cp public/largeIcon.png dist/
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì largeIcon.png copied${NC}"
else
    echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: public/largeIcon.png not found (130x130 required)"
fi

if [ -f "public/splashBackground.png" ]; then
    cp public/splashBackground.png dist/
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì splashBackground.png copied${NC}"
else
    echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: public/splashBackground.png not found (1920x1080 recommended)"
fi

# Step 4: Create ZIP package
echo -e "\n${BLUE}Step 4: Creating ZIP package...${NC}"
cd dist
zip -r ../ai-accountant-webos.zip . -q
cd ..

# Step 5: Show result
echo -e "\n${GREEN}‚úÖ SUCCESS!${NC}"
echo -e "Package created: ${GREEN}ai-accountant-webos.zip${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Next steps:"
echo "1. Go to https://developer.lge.com/webOSTV"
echo "2. Sign in to your developer account"
echo "3. Create new app ‚Üí Select 'Web App'"
echo "4. Upload ai-accountant-webos.zip"
echo "5. Fill in app details and submit for review"
echo ""
echo "üìù Don't forget to prepare:"
echo "   - Screenshots (1920x1080, minimum 2)"
echo "   - Privacy Policy URL"
echo "   - Support Email"
echo ""
